metadata.title: Tuesday, 22nd September, 2020
metadata.session: FIFTH SESSION OF THE TWELFTH ASSEMBLY

parts: (a) what the value of the white rhinos that were killed on 26th February, 2020, by a motor vehicle along the Livingstone - Kazungula road in the Mosi-oa-Tonya National Park was;
(b) whether the rhinos were tagged with cameras for easy monitoring of their movements;
(c) whether the rhinos were insured;
(d) if the rhinos were not insured, why; and
(e) how many white rhinos there were in the Park as of 1st March, 2020.
(a) what the total number of shooting incidents involving police officers was, from 2017 to 2019, countrywide;
(b) what measures the Government is taking to reduce the number of such incidents;
(c) whether police officers are regularly assessed to determine their mental capacity to handle fire arms; and
(d) if they are not assessed, why.

questions.minister: Minister of Housing and Infrastructure Development
parts: (a) what the total number of kilometres paved under the Pave Zambia 2000 Project was, as of July, 2020;
(b) what the total cost of procuring equipment for the project was;
(c) which areas of the country the equipment was distributed to;
(d) how many pavers were produced under the Project from 2013 to 2019, year by year; and
(e) how many jobs were created as of December, 2019.
(a) when construction of the 25 kilometres of township roads in Solwezi, which was commissioned by His Excellency the President, Mr Edgar Chagwa Lungu in 2015, will commence;
(b) what has caused the delay in commencing the project; and
(c) what the time frame for the completion of the project is. QUESTIONS FOR WRITTEN ANSWER W7. Mrs M L Phiri (Chilanga) - to ask the Minister of Local Government:
(a) in which newly created districts the Government was constructing the following infrastructure as of July, 2020:
(i) modern markets; (ii) bus stations; and (iii) staff houses;
(b) when construction of the infrastructure will commence in the rest of the newly created districts; and
(c) what the challenges in constructing the infrastructure are. W8. Mr Lufuma (Kabompo) - to ask the Minister of Housing and Infrastructure Development:
(a) when the rehabilitation of feeder roads under the World Bank supported Improved Rural Connectivity Project will commence;
(b) which provinces have been earmarked for implementation of the Project;
(c) how many kilometres of roads are earmarked for rehabilitation, province by province;
(d) of the kilometers at (c), how many were allocated to Kabompo District;
(e) what the total funding for the Project is;
(f) whether the Government has any plans to rehabilitate feeder roads in the provinces not covered by the Project; and
(g) if so, when the plans will be implemented.
